Very nice tutorials! 
I've read all three parts and wanted to congratulate =
you on the easy to understand explanatory style.
Have you already found out=
 why the evolution doesn't find the optimal solutions yet?
Keep up the good=
 work! thanks!

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wro=
te:
>
> Hi all,
> 
> I've just finished part 3 of the tutorial on using Sha=
rpNEAT 2:
> 
> http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/10/29/tutorial-%E2%80%93-evol=
ving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-3/
> 
> The running example thro=
ughout this series is building a Tic-Tac-Toe AI. 
> This part covers how to=
 use HyperNEAT in the experiment.
> 
> I'd appreciate any feedback, as alwa=
ys. I'm particularly interested if 
> Colin (or anyone else familiar with S=
N2 and HyperNEAT) finds anything 
> wrong with my experiment setup/code. Al=
so, I've made some 
> simplifications to terminology. If I made any erroneo=
us simplifications, 
> please let me know and I'll correct them.
> 
> Note =
that there was some discussion about using a non-coevolution setup. 
> I st=
ill plan on doing that, but this part doesn't have that piece. I 
> figured=
 it's better to release the part I have done, since I've had a 
> few peopl=
e ask for the HyperNEAT component.
> 
> Wesley
